lines.text:
[into a phone]
Marcy, if you hadn't kicked me out, I'd be home right now watching TV.
Damnit Marcie!
[first lines]

I told that goddamn son-of-a-bitch to have my car ready by five-goddamn-o'clock this afternoon, that asshole! Now I gotta drive around all fuckin' weekend in this goddamned rat-tailed piece of shit. It's bad enough I gotta drive this truck all week, now I gotta fuckin' drive it around all weekend!
William, why do you cus so much? I'll bet if you could go one day without cussin, you'd just roll over and die.
Well, goddamn Mary! If you had to drive around all weekend in this rat-tailed piece of shit, you'd cus too!
Well, I haven't said a single cus word yet, right?
That ain't the point. You ain't gotta drive it.
But I still gotta ride in it, right?
William, calm down. Stop cussin' at those motorists. They can't help it if they're fat. Besides, the way you drink you'd end up with a beer gut before long and then what? You'd cus yourself?
Now Mary, a fuckin' beer gut ain't the same thing as being fat.
Oh, they do. They do.
They don't fuckin' count! I know a lot of people that got a beer gut and ain't fuckin' fat.
Like who?
Like, Cowboy. And he's a skinny-ass motherfucker!
Oh, please! If there's a law against being fat, there ought to be a law against beer guts too.
There ain't no one gonna vote for it.
Well, I would.

Mary, just get off my back. I had a real hard day at work. And I'm driving around this rat-tailed piece of shit truck. I take you to a lotta nice places all the time, and all you do is give me a lotta shit.
What the hell's the matter with you?

Marcy kicked my damn ass out. Pissed me off! She said she didn't give a flying fuckwad what I'd do. She said I could sleep in my truck for all she cared. Shit! She loves that yappy dog of hers more then she loves me. I tell you one thing, that damn dog of here never had to sleep outside. And I never took a shit on the carpet.
